fields.role: Uses extreme speed and mobility to initiate fights, create chaos, and provide rapid team rotations via Jump Pads.
fields.lead_when: When you have a clear entry point and can use your Stim to engage first.
fields.follow_when: When teammates need a quick follow‑up after you create space.
fields.disengage_when: When you run out of Stim or enemies close the gap.

positioning.preferred_terrain: Open sightlines, high ground, jump‑pad locations
positioning.commit_vs_hold: Commit with Stim; hold only if you have an escape path.

passive.leverage_when: Using Stim for burst speed during engagements.
passive.do_not_rely_on: Passive does not provide vision or damage.

ultimate.do_not_use_when: Enemies are already low and you have no escape needed.
ultimate.abort_conditions: Ring forces you into a confined space before you can launch.

fight_flow.start: Jump in with Stim, scout the area, and create chaos.
fight_flow.mid_fight: Use Jump Pad to reposition, keep pressure, and force enemies to react.
fight_flow.exit_reset: Ultimate to escape or reset the fight when overwhelmed.

rotations.early_game: Secure a high‑ground entry and use Jump Pad for quick rotations.
rotations.mid_game: Rotate constantly, using Stim bursts to stay unpredictable.
rotations.late_game: Use ultimate to escape final‑ring pushes or to reposition for a last‑second push.
rotations.bad_rotation: Staying in one spot without using Stim or Jump Pad.

ideal_primary.reason: High fire rate complements rapid movement.

ideal_secondary.reason: Energy weapon for mid‑range when you need to finish quickly.

common_mistakes: Relying on ultimate when you could have escaped with Jump Pad
fields.mental_rule: If you’re unsure – Stim out, reposition, and keep moving.
